Content.Text: You are a highly skilled AI assistant trained in software development and project management communication. Your task is to transform raw Git commit messages into clear, non-technical time entries for invoicing purposes. These entries should be easy for project managers, product managers, and clients to understand. Avoid technical jargon and focus on explaining the work done in business terms.

I will provide you with a list of Git commit messages. Your task is to convert them into descriptive invoice time entries. Each entry should include:
- A summary of the work done in non-technical language
- An estimated time spent on the task (assume 2-4 hours per commit unless specified)
- A justification of why the work was necessary

Here are the commit messages:

Date: 2025-01-10
Author: John Doe
Commit Message: Fixed a bug in authentication middleware. The issue was causing token validation failures under certain edge cases. Additional logging has been added to track future occurrences.
Files Changed: src/AuthMiddleware.cs, tests/AuthMiddlewareTests.cs
-----
Date: 2025-01-11
Author: Jane Smith
Commit Message: Refactored database query logic to improve performance. The old query structure was causing slow response times on large datasets. Indexing strategies have been revised to optimize execution speed.
Files Changed: src/DatabaseService.cs, src/QueryOptimizer.cs
-----
Date: 2025-01-12
Author: John Doe
Commit Message: Added new API endpoint for user preferences. Users can now store and retrieve custom settings for their dashboard. Validation has been implemented to prevent malformed requests.
Files Changed: src/controllers/UserPreferencesController.cs, src/models/UserPreferences.cs, tests/UserPreferencesTests.cs
-----
Date: 2025-01-13
Author: Jane Smith
Commit Message: Fixed session timeout issues affecting user logins. The issue was related to incorrect token expiration calculations. A new mechanism ensures session persistence while respecting security policies.
Files Changed: src/SessionManager.cs, src/AuthService.cs, tests/SessionTests.cs
-----
Date: 2025-01-14
Author: John Doe
Commit Message: Implemented role-based access control (RBAC) for admin features. This update restricts certain operations to authorized users only. The feature has been tested with multiple role types to ensure compliance.
Files Changed: src/security/RBACMiddleware.cs, src/models/Role.cs, tests/RBACTests.cs
-----
Date: 2025-01-15
Author: Jane Smith
Commit Message: Refactored logging system to improve debugging capabilities. Logs are now categorized by severity levels for better readability. Additionally, new log filters have been introduced to isolate issues more effectively.
Files Changed: src/LoggingService.cs, src/LogFormatter.cs, tests/LoggingTests.cs
-----
Date: 2025-01-16
Author: John Doe
Commit Message: Enhanced database schema for better scalability. Adjusted foreign key constraints and optimized indexing. These improvements will result in faster query execution and reduced load times.
Files Changed: migrations/2025_01_16_add_indexes.sql, src/models/DatabaseSchema.cs
-----
Date: 2025-01-17
Author: Jane Smith
Commit Message: Optimized front-end JavaScript bundle size. Removed unused dependencies and replaced larger libraries with lightweight alternatives. This has improved page load speeds significantly.
Files Changed: src/js/main.js, package.json, webpack.config.js
-----
Date: 2025-01-18
Author: John Doe
Commit Message: Updated API documentation for clarity. Added missing endpoint descriptions and improved request/response examples. The documentation is now fully in sync with the latest API changes.
Files Changed: docs/api/endpoints.md, docs/api/authentication.md
-----
Date: 2025-01-19
Author: Jane Smith
Commit Message: Improved error handling across all microservices. Standardized error codes and messages for consistency. This will make debugging easier and provide better insights into failures.
Files Changed: src/microservices/ErrorHandler.cs, tests/ErrorHandlerTests.cs
-----

InvoiceEntries.OriginalCommitMessage: Fixed a bug in authentication middleware. The issue was causing token validation failures under certain edge cases. Additional logging has been added to track future occurrences.
InvoiceEntries.SummaryOfTheWorkDone: Resolved an issue in the authentication system that was causing token validation failures in rare situations. Enhanced logging to better monitor future occurrences of similar issues.
InvoiceEntries.JustificationForWhyTheWorkWasNecessary: This fix was crucial to ensure reliable user authentication and maintain system security.

InvoiceEntries.OriginalCommitMessage: Refactored database query logic to improve performance. The old query structure was causing slow response times on large datasets. Indexing strategies have been revised to optimize execution speed.
InvoiceEntries.SummaryOfTheWorkDone: Improved the performance of database queries by restructuring them and revising indexing strategies, leading to faster response times for large datasets.
InvoiceEntries.JustificationForWhyTheWorkWasNecessary: Enhancing database performance was necessary to improve user experience by reducing wait times for data retrieval.

InvoiceEntries.OriginalCommitMessage: Added new API endpoint for user preferences. Users can now store and retrieve custom settings for their dashboard. Validation has been implemented to prevent malformed requests.
InvoiceEntries.SummaryOfTheWorkDone: Developed a new API feature allowing users to save and access their dashboard preferences, with validation to ensure data integrity.
InvoiceEntries.JustificationForWhyTheWorkWasNecessary: This feature was added to enhance user personalization options, improving overall user satisfaction.

InvoiceEntries.OriginalCommitMessage: Fixed session timeout issues affecting user logins. The issue was related to incorrect token expiration calculations. A new mechanism ensures session persistence while respecting security policies.
InvoiceEntries.SummaryOfTheWorkDone: Resolved session timeout problems affecting user logins by correcting token expiration calculations, ensuring session stability while adhering to security protocols.
InvoiceEntries.JustificationForWhyTheWorkWasNecessary: Ensuring reliable session management is critical for user experience and security compliance.

InvoiceEntries.OriginalCommitMessage: Implemented role-based access control (RBAC) for admin features. This update restricts certain operations to authorized users only. The feature has been tested with multiple role types to ensure compliance.
InvoiceEntries.SummaryOfTheWorkDone: Introduced role-based access control for administrative functions, restricting access to authorized users to enhance security.
InvoiceEntries.JustificationForWhyTheWorkWasNecessary: Implementing RBAC was essential to protect sensitive operations and ensure only authorized personnel can perform certain actions.

InvoiceEntries.OriginalCommitMessage: Refactored logging system to improve debugging capabilities. Logs are now categorized by severity levels for better readability. Additionally, new log filters have been introduced to isolate issues more effectively.
InvoiceEntries.SummaryOfTheWorkDone: Enhanced the logging system by categorizing logs by severity and adding filters, improving the ability to diagnose and resolve issues.
InvoiceEntries.JustificationForWhyTheWorkWasNecessary: Improving the logging system was necessary to streamline debugging processes and enhance system maintainability.

InvoiceEntries.OriginalCommitMessage: Enhanced database schema for better scalability. Adjusted foreign key constraints and optimized indexing. These improvements will result in faster query execution and reduced load times.
InvoiceEntries.SummaryOfTheWorkDone: Upgraded the database schema to support scalability, optimizing indexing and foreign key constraints for improved performance.
InvoiceEntries.JustificationForWhyTheWorkWasNecessary: Optimizing the database schema was crucial for supporting future growth and ensuring efficient data handling.

InvoiceEntries.OriginalCommitMessage: Optimized front-end JavaScript bundle size. Removed unused dependencies and replaced larger libraries with lightweight alternatives. This has improved page load speeds significantly.
InvoiceEntries.SummaryOfTheWorkDone: Reduced the size of the front-end JavaScript bundle by eliminating unnecessary dependencies and using more efficient libraries, resulting in faster page loads.
InvoiceEntries.JustificationForWhyTheWorkWasNecessary: Enhancing page load speeds was important to improve user experience and reduce bounce rates.

InvoiceEntries.OriginalCommitMessage: Updated API documentation for clarity. Added missing endpoint descriptions and improved request/response examples. The documentation is now fully in sync with the latest API changes.
InvoiceEntries.SummaryOfTheWorkDone: Revised the API documentation to include missing details and improve clarity, ensuring it accurately reflects current API functionalities.
InvoiceEntries.JustificationForWhyTheWorkWasNecessary: Accurate and clear documentation is essential for developers to effectively use and integrate with the API.

InvoiceEntries.OriginalCommitMessage: Improved error handling across all microservices. Standardized error codes and messages for consistency. This will make debugging easier and provide better insights into failures.
InvoiceEntries.SummaryOfTheWorkDone: Enhanced error handling in microservices by standardizing error codes and messages, facilitating easier debugging and better failure analysis.
InvoiceEntries.JustificationForWhyTheWorkWasNecessary: Consistent error handling is vital for maintaining system reliability and simplifying troubleshooting processes.
